intro: Dendrocalamus somdevae, commonly known as the Somdeva bamboo, is a tall, fast-growing grass species native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Bambusoideae subfamily and is characterized by its robust, hollow stems that can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mixed forests at elevations between 1,000 and 2,500 meters. Its leaves are long and narrow, typically measuring up to 30 centimeters in length, and its culms are highly valued for their strength and flexibility. Dendrocalamus somdevae plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
